inventory_management_guide.title: Inventory Document Processing: The Technical Guide for Warehouse Operations

expert_sections.title: Packing List Field Mapping: Source Document to WMS/ERP
expert_sections.content: Packing lists contain critical inventory data that must be accurately extracted and mapped to your warehouse management and ERP systems. DocStandard standardizes the following key fields:

mapping_data.normalization_logic: Extract SKU codes; Validate format against item master; Map to internal product IDs; Flag unknown SKUs for review.
Extract numeric quantity; Standardize unit of measure (EA, CS, PLT, etc.); Convert to base unit if needed; Validate against order quantities.
Extract product descriptions; Clean and standardize text; Match against product master for consistency; Flag discrepancies.
Extract lot/serial identifiers; Validate format; Link to inventory records; Flag duplicate or invalid lot numbers.
Extract package identifiers; Validate uniqueness; Link packages to shipment; Track package-level quantities.
Extract weight (standardize to lbs or kg); Parse dimensions (LxWxH); Calculate cube; Validate against product master data.
Extract location codes; Validate against warehouse layout; Map to WMS location hierarchy (Zone-Aisle-Rack-Shelf).
Extract date fields; Standardize format (MM/DD/YYYY); Calculate days until expiration; Flag expired or near-expiry items.

expert_sections.title: Warehouse Receiving Documentation
expert_sections.content:
Receiving operations require accurate documentation to maintain inventory accuracy and prevent discrepancies:

- **ASN (Advanced Shipping Notice) Matching:** Match packing lists against ASNs to validate expected vs. received quantities, flagging shortages or overages.
- **Damage Reporting:** Extract damage notes and condition codes from receiving documents, routing damaged items to quality control workflows.
- **Put-Away Instructions:** Parse location assignments from receiving documents, ensuring items are placed in correct warehouse zones.
- **Vendor Compliance:** Validate packing list formats against vendor compliance requirements, flagging non-compliant shipments for review.
- **Cross-Dock Processing:** Identify cross-dock shipments from packing list data, routing items directly to outbound staging without put-away.

DocStandard ensures receiving documentation is complete, accurate, and ready for immediate WMS import, reducing receiving cycle time by up to 40%.

expert_sections.title: Inventory Reconciliation and Cycle Counting
expert_sections.content:
Accurate inventory counts depend on reliable documentation processing:

1. **Cycle Count Preparation:** Extract item lists and expected quantities from cycle count worksheets, generating count sheets with current system quantities.
2. **Variance Analysis:** Compare physical count data against system quantities, flagging discrepancies above tolerance thresholds.
3. **Adjustment Documentation:** Process inventory adjustment forms, ensuring proper GL coding and approval workflows are maintained.
4. **ABC Analysis:** Classify items by value and velocity from inventory reports, prioritizing high-value items for more frequent counts.
5. **Location Accuracy:** Validate bin locations from cycle count sheets against WMS location data, identifying mis-located inventory.

DocStandard processes cycle count and reconciliation documents, ensuring inventory adjustments are properly documented and traceable for audit purposes.

expert_sections.title: SKU Master Data Management
expert_sections.content:
Maintaining accurate SKU master data is critical for inventory operations:

- **New Item Setup:** Extract product attributes (dimensions, weight, UOM, category) from vendor catalogs or product sheets, creating standardized SKU records.
- **Attribute Updates:** Process product change notifications, updating SKU attributes (pricing, dimensions, descriptions) while maintaining change history.
- **Duplicate Detection:** Identify duplicate SKUs across multiple systems or catalogs, consolidating records to prevent inventory fragmentation.
- **Taxonomy Classification:** Map product descriptions to standardized product categories and hierarchies, ensuring consistent classification across systems.
- **Cross-Reference Maintenance:** Link internal SKUs to vendor part numbers, customer SKUs, and barcode identifiers, maintaining complete cross-reference tables.

DocStandard processes SKU master data documents, ensuring your product database remains accurate and synchronized across WMS, ERP, and e-commerce platforms.

expert_sections.title: ROI Analysis: Manual vs. Automated Packing List Processing
expert_sections.content:
For a warehouse processing 2,000 packing lists per week:

- **Manual Entry:** 4 minutes per packing list = 133 hours/week of data entry
- **Error Rate:** 6-10% requiring correction = 120-200 packing lists with downstream issues (inventory discrepancies, shipping errors)
- **DocStandard Processing:** Batch upload + automated extraction = 3 hours/week
- **Accuracy:** 99%+ with exception flagging for review

**Annual Savings:**
- Labor: $150,000+ in reclaimed warehouse operations time
- Error Cost Avoidance: $50,000+ in inventory write-offs and shipping corrections
- Inventory Accuracy: 99.5%+ vs. 94% with manual entry, reducing stockouts and overstock situations
